issues.description: The addAnimal method in the Farm class is declared to return a boolean in the problem statement (indicating success or failure), but in the solution repository, it is implemented as returning void, which contradicts the specified design. This inconsistency could confuse students who follow the problem statement, leading them to expect a return value that isn't present in the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the addAnimal method in the solution repository to return a boolean value, aligning with the problem statement, such as 'return animals.add(animal);' to indicate whether the addition was successful. Ensure the template repository includes this corrected signature if it's added later to avoid student confusion.

issues.description: The singFarmSongVerse method in the Farm class in the template repository is declared without any parameters, while the problem statement specifies it should take an Animal parameter, and the solution repository implements it with this parameter. This mismatch could prevent students from correctly implementing the method as described, causing confusion when trying to integrate it with the rest of the Farm class logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Modify the singFarmSongVerse method in the template repository to include the Animal parameter as specified, e.g., 'private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)', to ensure students can build upon a structure that matches the problem description without needing to alter the method signature.
